description: Root object for *Ironsworn: Starforged* game data.

$id.description: The item's unique string ID. Any object that contains a localizable user-facing string *must* have this key.
$id.title: $id

Summary.description: A user-facing markdown summary of the item. Summary is shorter than {@link HasDescription| Description}, when they're both present.
Summary.title: Summary

Quest starter.description: A markdown string describing the quest starter associated with this item.
Quest starter.title: Quest starter

Your truth.description:
Ironsworn, p. 135: "Some NPCs include a question for you to answer. This is an opportunity to customize the NPC to your vision of the Ironlands. You can do this as you define your world or discover through play. Truths may represent an absolute fact, or merely something the people of your world believe."

Only present in Ironsworn encounters.
Your truth.title: Your truth

Display.description: Data relevant to this item's display/rendering.
Display.title: Display

Tags.description: Arbitrary strings tags that describe optional metadata that doesn't fit in other properties.
Tags.title: Tags

Description.description: A user-facing markdown description of the item, consisting of one or more paragraphs.
Description.title: Description

EncounterVariant.description: Represents a variant encounter 'stubs' included with a parent encounter in *Ironsworn: Starforged*.
EncounterVariant.title: EncounterVariant

$id.description: The item's unique string ID. Any object that contains a localizable user-facing string *must* have this key.
$id.title: $id

Tags.description: Arbitrary strings tags that describe optional metadata that doesn't fit in other properties.
Tags.title: Tags

Display.description: Data relevant to this item's display/rendering.
Display.title: Display

Description.description: A user-facing markdown description of the item, consisting of one or more paragraphs.
Description.title: Description

$id.description: The item's unique string ID. Any object that contains a localizable user-facing string *must* have this key.
$id.title: $id

Canonical.description:
The title of this item, which here is defined as the associated header text *exactly* as it appears on the page.

For items that represent a single table column, this is the label that appears at the top of the column.

Use this title if you want high fidelity to the book. For most interactive UX, it's recommended to use {@link Title.Standard} instead.
Canonical.title: Canonical

Standard.description:
The recommended title for most implementations.

This is usually the same as the canonical title, but editorializes a bit by trimming out things like "Oracle 15" in some Ironsworn oracles (because *nobody* remembers it as "Oracle 15").

If you need the shortest possible name, see {@link Title.Short} instead.
Standard.title: Standard

Short.description:
The shortest title for this item that remains distinct amongst its siblings.

Unless you're very pressed for space, most UX should use {@link Title.Standard} instead.
Short.title: Short

Display.description: Interface for data relevant to an item's display/rendering.
Display.title: Display

Icon.description: A URL pointing to a single SVG icon.
Icon.title: Icon

Images.description: An array of URLs pointing to one or more WEBP images.
Images.title: Images

Color.description: A hex color associated with this item, for use as e.g. an accent color in its display.
Color.title: Color

Source.description: Interface representing data on this item's source. For 'canonical' content, this is usually a book with numbered pages, but it might also be a link to a web site.
Source.title: Source

Title.description:
The title of the source.

For 'canonical' content, use one of the enumerated `SourceTitle` strings.

For 3rd-party content (including homebrew) that's been released as part of a titled document, use the title of that document (e.g. "Steelforged", "Ironsmith").

If the source has no particular title (for instance, it's a single custom element in a VTT implementation), use "Custom".
Title.title: Title

Authors.description: The author(s) of this item. For 'canonical' content, this one's usually pretty obvious 😉 However, it's included so that homebrew content can use the same interface/schema.
Authors.title: Authors

Date.description: The 6-number date string formatted as `MMDDYY`. Relevant only during Starforged development; it will be deprecated once the game is released.
Date.title: Date

Page.description: The page on which the item appears most prominently in the source material (if it's in a format that uses page numbers).
Page.title: Page

Url.description: The URL where the source material is available.
Url.title: Url

License.description: The URL pointing to the license which this content falls under.
License.title: License

TruthStarforged.description: Interface for Starforged Setting Truth categories such as "Exodus" and "Cataclysm". See page XX of Starforged for further information.
TruthStarforged.title: TruthStarforged

$id.description: The item's unique string ID. Any object that contains a localizable user-facing string *must* have this key.
$id.title: $id

Table.description: The 'canonical' options for this setting truth category.
Table.title: Table

Character.description: A Markdown version of the text that appears at the end of each Truth entry; it offers suggestions on the character's assets and background.
Character.title: Character

Display.description: Data relevant to this item's display/rendering.
Display.title: Display

Suggestions.description: "Non-canonical" suggestions of related items. They might be convenient to present to the user, but in most implementations rolling them automatically is not recommended.
Suggestions.title: Suggestions

TruthOptionStarforged.description: Interface for 'canonical' options within a {@link TruthStarforged} category.
TruthOptionStarforged.title: TruthOptionStarforged

$id.description: The ID of this row.
$id.title: $id

Roll template.description: Describes the string values of this item that should be replaced with template strings and filled with the results of one or more oracle rolls.
Roll template.title: Roll template

Subtable.description: A table to be rolled when this row is selected. If this row references an external oracle, the `Oracles` property is used instead.
Subtable.title: Subtable

anyOf.description: The low end of the dice range for this row.
The high end of the dice range for this row.

Result.description:
The primary result text for the row, annotated in Markdown.
In the book, this is frequently the only column aside from the roll column. Otherwise, it is the first column.
Some tables label this column as something other than Result; see the parent (or grandparent) Oracle.Display for more information.
Result.title: Result

Summary.description:
A secondary markdown string that must be presented to the user for the implementation to be complete, but may benefit from progressive disclosure (such as a collapsible element, popover/tooltip, etc).

Generally, `Summary` is longer than `Result`.

Some tables label this column as something other than `Result`; see the parent (or grandparent) `Oracle.Display.Table` for more information.

`null` is used in cases where an 'empty' `Summary` exists (example: Starship Type, p. 326). In the book, these table cells are rendered with the text `--` (and this is the recommended placeholder for tabular display). For display as a single result (e.g. VTT table roll output), however, `null` values can be safely omitted.
Summary.title: Summary

Oracle rolls.description: Additional oracle tables that should be rolled when this row is selected.
Oracle rolls.title: Oracle rolls

Multiple rolls.description: Data for rows that call for multiple rolls, e.g. on `Roll twice` results.
Multiple rolls.title: Multiple rolls

Attributes.description: The attributes set by this row.
Attributes.title: Attributes

Suggestions.description: "Non-canonical" suggestions of related items. They might be convenient to present to the user, but in most implementations rolling them automatically is not recommended.
Suggestions.title: Suggestions

Content.description: Metadata that describes an oracle's semantic or lexical content.
Content.title: Content

Game objects.description: Any game objects that are explicitly pointed to by the original text. For most implementations, it is *not* recommended to generate them automatically - see "Peeling the Onion", p. 293.
Game objects.title: Game objects

Display.description: Data relevant to this item's display/rendering.
Display.title: Display

Quest starter.description: A markdown string describing the quest starter associated with this item.
Quest starter.title: Quest starter

Description.description: A user-facing markdown description of the item, consisting of one or more paragraphs.
Description.title: Description

RollTemplate.description: Describes the string keys of this item that should be replaced with template strings and filled with the results of one or more oracles.
RollTemplate.title: RollTemplate

$id.description: The item's unique string ID. Any object that contains a localizable user-facing string *must* have this key.
$id.title: $id

Result.description: A template string for the parent's `Result` property, to be filled with an oracle table roll Result.
Result.title: Result

Summary.description: A template string for the parent's `Summary` property, to be filled with an oracle table roll Result.
Summary.title: Summary

Description.description: A template string for the parent's `Description` property, to be filled with an oracle table roll Result.
Description.title: Description

$id.description: The ID of this row.
$id.title: $id

anyOf.description: The low end of the dice range for this row.
The high end of the dice range for this row.

Game objects.title: Game objects

Display.title: Display

OracleTableRow.description: Interface representing a single row in an oracle table.
OracleTableRow.title: OracleTableRow

$id.title: $id

anyOf.description: The low end of the dice range for this row.

Suggestions.description: "Non-canonical" suggestions of related items. They might be convenient to present to the user, but in most implementations rolling them automatically is not recommended.
Suggestions.title: Suggestions

Content.description: Metadata that describes an oracle's semantic or lexical content.
Content.title: Content

Game objects.description: Any game objects that are explicitly pointed to by the original text. For most implementations, it is *not* recommended to generate them automatically - see "Peeling the Onion", p. 293.
Game objects.title: Game objects

Display.description: Data relevant to this item's display/rendering.
Display.title: Display

MultipleRolls.description: Describes {@link OracleTableRow} results that call for multiple rolls, most commonly "Roll twice" results.
MultipleRolls.title: MultipleRolls

Amount.description: The number of rolls to make on the parent oracle table.
Amount.title: Amount

Allow duplicates.description:
Whether to allow duplicate results when generating multiple rolls.

Implicitly required by `Make it worse`.
Allow duplicates.title: Allow duplicates

Make it worse.description:
Whether duplicate rolls should be compounded in an Ironsworn-style "Make it worse" results.

Typically this is accompanied by `Row.Result` text like "Roll twice more on this table. Both results occur. If they are the same result, make it worse."

Can safely be ignored in Starforged-only implementations. Implicitly requires `Allow duplicates`.
Make it worse.title: Make it worse

Attribute.description:
Describes an attribute key/value pair, set by an oracle row. The key-value pair should be set on any game object for which that row is generated.

Attributes exist to describe prerequisites that might be fulfilled by more than one table, that don't exist on tables at all, or that a generated game object might want to 'force' as one of it's roll results.

See documentation for a list of available values.
Attribute.title: Attribute

RollTemplate_1.description: Describes the string keys of this item that should be replaced with template strings and filled with the results of one or more oracles.
RollTemplate_1.title: RollTemplate_1

Suggestions.description:
Describes "non-canonical" suggestions for game content related to the parent item.

These are intended be offered as convenient shortcuts for the user (for instance, including a menu dropdown for rolling on suggested tables); having them roll automatically is **not recommended** for most projects.

These can be safely ignored if that functionality is not desired.
Suggestions.title: Suggestions

Suggestions_1.description:
Describes "non-canonical" suggestions for game content related to the parent item.

These are intended be offered as convenient shortcuts for the user (for instance, including a menu dropdown for rolling on suggested tables); having them roll automatically is **not recommended** for most projects.

These can be safely ignored if that functionality is not desired.
Suggestions_1.title: Suggestions_1

Game objects.description: Suggested game objects and their parameters.
Game objects.title: Game objects

Oracle rolls.description: Suggested oracle rolls, by table ID. Multiples of the same ID can be used to indicate that multiple rolls should be made.
Oracle rolls.title: Oracle rolls

GameObject.description: Describes a game object, with optional required parameters (for example, a specific Location result).
GameObject.title: GameObject

Attributes.description: A list of attribute keys, and values of those keys that satisfy the requirements.
Attributes.title: Attributes

OracleContent.description: Interface for metadata that describes an oracle's semantic or lexical content.
OracleContent.title: OracleContent

OracleContent_1.description: Interface for metadata that describes an oracle's semantic or lexical content.
OracleContent_1.title: OracleContent_1

Part of speech.description: The part of speech of this oracle.
Part of speech.title: Part of speech

Tags.description: Any arbitrary string tags associated with this oracle.
Tags.title: Tags

Display_1.description: Interface for data relevant to an item's display/rendering.
Display_1.title: Display_1

Suggestions_2.description:
Describes "non-canonical" suggestions for game content related to the parent item.

These are intended be offered as convenient shortcuts for the user (for instance, including a menu dropdown for rolling on suggested tables); having them roll automatically is **not recommended** for most projects.

These can be safely ignored if that functionality is not desired.
Suggestions_2.title: Suggestions_2

AssetType.description: Represents an Asset Type such as Command Vehicle, Companion, or Path, and serves as a container for all assets of that type.
AssetType.title: AssetType

$id.description: The item's unique string ID. Any object that contains a localizable user-facing string *must* have this key.
$id.title: $id

Assets.description: The assets that belong to this asset type.
Assets.title: Assets

Display.description: Data relevant to this item's display/rendering.
Display.title: Display

Description.description: A user-facing markdown description of the item, consisting of one or more paragraphs.
Description.title: Description

Aliases.description: Alternate names for this item, including: names it had earlier in development that have since changed, alternate spellings/punctuation, common misspellings, and so on.
Aliases.title: Aliases

Asset.description: An interface representing an *Ironsworn: Starforged* asset card.
Asset.title: Asset

$id.description: The item's unique string ID. Any object that contains a localizable user-facing string *must* have this key.
$id.title: $id

Display.description: Data relevant to this item's display/rendering.
Display.title: Display

States.description: Describes any states that the asset might have, such as "Broken". Some states may disable the asset entirely.
States.title: States

Asset type.description: The ID of the asset's parent AssetType
Asset type.title: Asset type

Usage.description: Information on the asset's usage, such as whether its abilities are shared amongst the player characters.
Usage.title: Usage

Attachments.description: Details on what attachments (other assets) are accepted by this asset.
Attachments.title: Attachments

Inputs.description: Data describing the Input controls that should be embedded in the card. Inputs embedded in specific asset abilities appear as keys of the corresponding ability object, instead.
Inputs.title: Inputs

Requirement.description: An optional markdown string representing the requirement text that appears at the top of some asset cards.
Requirement.title: Requirement

Condition meter.description: Information on this asset's condition meter, if any.
Condition meter.title: Condition meter

Aliases.description: Alternate names for this item, including: names it had earlier in development that have since changed, alternate spellings/punctuation, common misspellings, and so on.
Aliases.title: Aliases

Canonical.description:
The title of this item, which here is defined as the associated header text *exactly* as it appears on the page.

For items that represent a single table column, this is the label that appears at the top of the column.

Use this title if you want high fidelity to the book. For most interactive UX, it's recommended to use {@link Title.Standard} instead.
Canonical.title: Canonical

Standard.description:
The recommended title for most implementations.

This is usually the same as the canonical title, but editorializes a bit by trimming out things like "Oracle 15" in some Ironsworn oracles (because *nobody* remembers it as "Oracle 15").

If you need the shortest possible name, see {@link Title.Short} instead.
Standard.title: Standard

Short.description:
The shortest title for this item that remains distinct amongst its siblings.

Unless you're very pressed for space, most UX should use {@link Title.Standard} instead.
Short.title: Short

$id.description: The item's unique string ID. Any object that contains a localizable user-facing string *must* have this key.
$id.title: $id

AssetState.description:
Describes a possible state for an asset, like the "broken" status for certain assets (mainly Modules in *Starforged*).

States are frequently toggled on and off by players; for real-world gameplay, this is generally represented by flipping the card over. A checkbox or other on/off toggle might serve the same function in a digital implementation.
AssetState.title: AssetState

Label.description: A string label for the state.
Label.title: Label

Enabled.description: Whether this state is currently enabled.
Enabled.title: Enabled

Disables asset.description: Whether this state should disable the entire asset when `AssetState.Enabled === true`
Disables asset.title: Disables asset

Impact.description:
Whether this state counts as an Impact for the asset's owner.

Note that for vehicles, this shouldn't be applied automatically unless your implementation has some way of telling which vehicle the PC is currently using.
Impact.title: Impact

Permanent.description: Whether or not this state is permanent.
Permanent.title: Permanent

$id.description: The item's unique string ID. Any object that contains a localizable user-facing string *must* have this key.
$id.title: $id

Shared.description:
Whether the asset's abilities are shared with Allies.

If set to `true`, the asset's abilities can be invoked by **any** player character; if your app facilitates co-op or guided play, consider how you might expose these abilities to players other than the asset's owner.

Defaults to `true` for Command Vehicle, Support Vehicle, and Module assets.
Shared.title: Shared

AssetAttachment.description: Details which assets are valid attachments. The most prominent example in *Ironsworn: Starforged* is the STARSHIP asset (`Starship/Assets/Command_vehicle/Starship`); Rover (`Starship/Assets/Support_vehicle/Rover`) also has an elective ability that adds this property.
AssetAttachment.title: AssetAttachment

Asset types.description: The type of asset that this asset accepts as attachments.
Asset types.title: Asset types

Max.description: The maximum number of attached assets accepted by this asset. If undefined or null, there is no maximum.
Max.title: Max

InputClock.description: An input representing an *Ironsworn: Starforged* clock.
InputClock.title: InputClock

Clock type.description: Whether the clock is a Tension Clock or a Campaign Clock. For assets this doesn't really matter since they have their own specific trigger conditions, and can probably be ignored.
Clock type.title: Clock type

Segments.description:
An integer representing the total number of segments in this Clock. *Ironsworn: Starforged* uses clocks with 4, 6, 8, and 10 segments.

`Filled` should not exceed this number.
Segments.title: Segments

Filled.description: An integer representing how many filled segments this clock has. This is always 0 in Dataforged; it's included to make it easy to store clock states with the same interface.
Filled.title: Filled

$id.description: The item's unique string ID. Any object that contains a localizable user-facing string *must* have this key.
$id.title: $id

Adjustable.description:
Whether the input's value is expected to change over the course of a campaign. For example, name fields are typically `false`, while something like a clock or tally would be `true`.

It's a good idea to make everything editable regardless, but this property might inform whether your UI presents that functionality "front and center" or as a secondary interaction (via long press, right click, etc);
Adjustable.title: Adjustable

Label.description: The user-facing text label of this item.
Label.title: Label

InputNumber.description:
An input where the user sets an integer.
Suggested rendering: a number input spinner, similar to `<input type='number'>` in HTML.
InputNumber.title: InputNumber

$id.description: The item's unique string ID. Any object that contains a localizable user-facing string *must* have this key.
$id.title: $id

Adjustable.description:
Whether the input's value is expected to change over the course of a campaign. For example, name fields are typically `false`, while something like a clock or tally would be `true`.

It's a good idea to make everything editable regardless, but this property might inform whether your UI presents that functionality "front and center" or as a secondary interaction (via long press, right click, etc);
Adjustable.title: Adjustable

Label.description: The user-facing text label of this item.
Label.title: Label

InputSelect.description:
An input where the user selects a single option from a list of pre-set options.
Suggested rendering: a drop-down selection menu.
InputSelect.title: InputSelect

Sets attributes.description: Hints which attribute(s) are set by this dropdown's options.
Sets attributes.title: Sets attributes

$id.description: The item's unique string ID. Any object that contains a localizable user-facing string *must* have this key.
$id.title: $id

Adjustable.description:
Whether the input's value is expected to change over the course of a campaign. For example, name fields are typically `false`, while something like a clock or tally would be `true`.

It's a good idea to make everything editable regardless, but this property might inform whether your UI presents that functionality "front and center" or as a secondary interaction (via long press, right click, etc);
Adjustable.title: Adjustable

Label.description: The user-facing text label of this item.
Label.title: Label

InputSelectAttributeDefinition.description: Provides hints for the keys and typing of an {@link InputSelect}'s child {@link InputSelectOption}s.
InputSelectAttributeDefinition.title: InputSelectAttributeDefinition

InputSelectOptionType.description: The type of an attribute set by a Select Input.
InputSelectOptionType.title: InputSelectOptionType

InputSelectOption.description: Represents an option in an {@link InputSelect}.
InputSelectOption.title: InputSelectOption

$id.description: The item's unique string ID. Any object that contains a localizable user-facing string *must* have this key.
$id.title: $id

Set attributes.description: A keyed object describing what attribute keys should be set to when this option is active. *All* items in the object should be set in this manner.
Set attributes.title: Set attributes

Label.description: The user-facing text label of this item.
Label.title: Label

$id.description: The item's unique string ID. Any object that contains a localizable user-facing string *must* have this key.
$id.title: $id

InputText.description:
A text input.
Suggested rendering: a single-line text input, similar to `<input type='text'>` in HTML.
InputText.title: InputText

$id.description: The item's unique string ID. Any object that contains a localizable user-facing string *must* have this key.
$id.title: $id

Adjustable.description:
Whether the input's value is expected to change over the course of a campaign. For example, name fields are typically `false`, while something like a clock or tally would be `true`.

It's a good idea to make everything editable regardless, but this property might inform whether your UI presents that functionality "front and center" or as a secondary interaction (via long press, right click, etc);
Adjustable.title: Adjustable

Label.description: The user-facing text label of this item.
Label.title: Label

AssetAbility.description: Represents one of an asset's three abilities.
AssetAbility.title: AssetAbility

$id.description: The item's unique string ID. Any object that contains a localizable user-facing string *must* have this key.
$id.title: $id

Label.description: Ironsworn companion assets provide labels for their abilities. Starforged asset abilities do not have labels.
Label.title: Label

Moves.description: New moves added by this asset ability.
Moves.title: Moves

Inputs.description: User inputs (text, clocks, etc) associated with this asset ability.
Inputs.title: Inputs

Alter moves.description: Information on how this ability alters moves when enabled.
Alter moves.title: Alter moves

Alter properties.description: Information on how this ability alters its parent asset when enabled.
Alter properties.title: Alter properties

Alter momentum.description: Information on how this ability alters its owner's momentum (triggers an effect on burn, on reset, etc)
Alter momentum.title: Alter momentum

Enabled.description: Whether the asset ability is enabled or not. In most cases, the first asset ability defaults to 'true' and the others to 'false'. If none of an asset's abilities are set to 'true', the player can pick which the ability they start with when purchasing the asset.
Enabled.title: Enabled

Text.description: The item's rules text as a markdown string.
Text.title: Text

$id.description: The item's unique string ID. Any object that contains a localizable user-facing string *must* have this key.
$id.title: $id

Title.description: Note the "Canonical" key for asset-specific moves is something of a misnomer, as in the original text doesn't name them. They're provided in the same format for convenience, however.
Title.title: Title

Asset.description: The ID of the parent Asset of the move, if any.
Asset.title: Asset

Category.description: The ID of the move's category.
Category.title: Category

Progress move.description: Whether or not the move is a Progress Move. Progress moves roll two challenge dice against a progress score.
Progress move.title: Progress move

Variant of.description: The ID of the move that this move is a variant of, if any.
Variant of.title: Variant of

Oracles.description: The IDs of any oracles directly referenced by the move, or vice versa.
Oracles.title: Oracles

Text.description: The item's rules text as a markdown string.
Text.title: Text

Display.description: Data relevant to this item's display/rendering.
Display.title: Display

Optional.description: Whether or not the source material presents this rules item as optional.
Optional.title: Optional

Suggestions.description: "Non-canonical" suggestions of related items. They might be convenient to present to the user, but in most implementations rolling them automatically is not recommended.
Suggestions.title: Suggestions

MoveTrigger.description: Describes the trigger conditions of the move.
MoveTrigger.title: MoveTrigger

$id.description: The item's unique string ID. Any object that contains a localizable user-facing string *must* have this key.
$id.title: $id

Text.description:
A markdown string containing the primary trigger text for this move.

Secondary triggers (for specific stats or uses of an asset ability) are described in `Options`.
Text.title: Text

By.description:
Information on who can trigger this item. Used mainly by asset abilities, some of which can trigger from an Ally's move.

If unspecified, assume `Ally` is `false` and `Player` is `true`.
By.title: By

Options.description:
Information on any action rolls or progress rolls that are made when this move is triggered (which may describe a specific subset of the primary trigger in their own `Text` property).

If there's no action rolls or progress rolls attached to this move, this is `undefined`.
Options.title: Options

Player.description: Whether the player character who owns this item can trigger it. Unsurprisingly, this is usually true, but there's a few exceptions: see *Starforged's* LOYALIST asset for an example.
Player.title: Player

Ally.description: Whether an Ally (a player character other than the owner) can trigger this item. This is usually false, but there's several exceptions among asset abilities.
Ally.title: Ally

Roll type.description: Whether this option is an action roll or progress roll.
Roll type.title: Roll type

Using.description: The stat(s) or progress track(s) that may be rolled with this move trigger option.
Using.title: Using

$id.description: The item's unique string ID. Any object that contains a localizable user-facing string *must* have this key.
$id.title: $id

Method.description: The method used to choose the stat or track in the `Using` array.
Method.title: Method

Custom stat.description: Defines a custom stat, if one is included in this object's `With` array.
Custom stat.title: Custom stat

Text.description: The item's rules text as a markdown string.
Text.title: Text

RollMethod.description: The stat(s) or progress track(s) that may be rolled with the parent move trigger option.
RollMethod.title: RollMethod

$id.description: The item's unique string ID. Any object that contains a localizable user-facing string *must* have this key.
$id.title: $id

Label.description: The user-facing text label of this item.
Label.title: Label

$id.description: The item's unique string ID. Any object that contains a localizable user-facing string *must* have this key.
$id.title: $id

Value.description: The numeric value to be used as +stat when making an Action Roll.
Value.title: Value

Label.description: The user-facing text label of this item.
Label.title: Label

Roll type.description: Whether this option is an action roll or progress roll.
Roll type.title: Roll type

Using.description: The stat(s) or progress track(s) that may be rolled with this move trigger option.
Using.title: Using

$id.description: The item's unique string ID. Any object that contains a localizable user-facing string *must* have this key.
$id.title: $id

Method.description: The method used to choose the stat or track in the `Using` array.
Method.title: Method

Custom stat.description: Defines a custom stat, if one is included in this object's `With` array.
Custom stat.title: Custom stat

Text.description: The item's rules text as a markdown string.
Text.title: Text

$id.description: The item's unique string ID. Any object that contains a localizable user-facing string *must* have this key.
$id.title: $id

$id.description: The item's unique string ID. Any object that contains a localizable user-facing string *must* have this key.
$id.title: $id

With a match.description: Defines a different outcome for this result with a match. Its text should replace the text of this object.
With a match.title: With a match

In control.description: Whether this outcome leaves the player character in control (Starforged) or with initiative (Ironsworn) or not. If unspecified, assume that it's `true` on a Strong Hit, and `false` on a Weak Hit or Miss.
In control.title: In control

Count as.description: Count this roll as another roll outcome, e.g. "Count a weak hit as a miss"
Count as.title: Count as

Reroll.description: Information on rerolls offered by this move.
Reroll.title: Reroll

Text.description: The item's rules text as a markdown string.
Text.title: Text

$id.description: The item's unique string ID. Any object that contains a localizable user-facing string *must* have this key.
$id.title: $id

Text.description: The item's rules text as a markdown string.
Text.title: Text

Count as.description: Count this roll as another roll outcome, e.g. "Count a weak hit as a miss"
Count as.title: Count as

Reroll.description: Information on rerolls offered by this move.
Reroll.title: Reroll

MoveReroll.description: Describes a reroll offered by a move outcome. The vast majority of rerolls in *Ironsworn* are elective, so automatic rerolling isn't recommended.
MoveReroll.title: MoveReroll

$id.description: The item's unique string ID. Any object that contains a localizable user-facing string *must* have this key.
$id.title: $id

Text.description: The markdown string describing the conditions of the reroll. It should be presented to the user so that they can decide whether a reroll is appropriate.
Text.title: Text

RerollType.description: Enumerates which dice are to be rerolled.
RerollType.title: RerollType

$id.description: The item's unique string ID. Any object that contains a localizable user-facing string *must* have this key.
$id.title: $id

With a match.title: With a match

In control.title: In control

Text.title: Text

$id.description: The item's unique string ID. Any object that contains a localizable user-facing string *must* have this key.

In control.title: In control

Text.title: Text

AlterMove.description: Describes alterations applied to moves by asset abilities.
AlterMove.title: AlterMove

$id.description: The item's unique string ID. Any object that contains a localizable user-facing string *must* have this key.
$id.title: $id

Moves.description: The `$id`s of the move(s) to be altered. If it's `null`, it can alter *any* move to which its trigger conditions apply. If it's `undefined`, see `Extends` instead.
Moves.title: Moves

Alters.description: Some asset abilities alter/extend other asset abilities, specified as an array of IDs. Only changed properties are specified; other properties are the same.
Alters.title: Alters

Trigger.description: The trigger required by the asset ability. If `undefined`, the move alteration applies to all uses of the specified moves, so long as they also meet any implicit asset requirements (fictional framing, `Asset.Requirement`, not being Broken or Out of Action, etc).
Trigger.title: Trigger

Text.description: Markdown rules text describing added effects which apply *before* the move is rolled, such as adds.
Text.title: Text

Outcomes.description: Added rules text that applies on move outcomes.
Outcomes.title: Outcomes

Suggestions.description: "Non-canonical" suggestions of related items. They might be convenient to present to the user, but in most implementations rolling them automatically is not recommended.
Suggestions.title: Suggestions

Title.description: Note the "Canonical" key for asset-specific moves is something of a misnomer, as in the original text doesn't name them. They're provided in the same format for convenience, however.
Title.title: Title

Asset.description: The ID of the parent Asset of the move, if any.
Asset.title: Asset

Category.description: The ID of the move's category.
Category.title: Category

Progress move.description: Whether or not the move is a Progress Move. Progress moves roll two challenge dice against a progress score.
Progress move.title: Progress move

Variant of.description: The ID of the move that this move is a variant of, if any.
Variant of.title: Variant of

Oracles.description: The IDs of any oracles directly referenced by the move, or vice versa.
Oracles.title: Oracles

Display.description: Data relevant to this item's display/rendering.
Display.title: Display

Optional.description: Whether or not the source material presents this rules item as optional.
Optional.title: Optional

$id.description: The item's unique string ID. Any object that contains a localizable user-facing string *must* have this key.
$id.title: $id

Reroll.title: Reroll

Text.description: The item's rules text as a markdown string.
Text.title: Text

Display_2.description: Interface for data relevant to an item's display/rendering.
Display_2.title: Display_2

Source_1.description: Interface representing data on this item's source. For 'canonical' content, this is usually a book with numbered pages, but it might also be a link to a web site.
Source_1.title: Source_1

AssetAlterProperties.description: Describes changes that an asset ability makes to its parent asset when active. Any properties with object values should be merged recursively.
AssetAlterProperties.title: AssetAlterProperties

$id.description: The item's unique string ID. Any object that contains a localizable user-facing string *must* have this key.
$id.title: $id

States.description: Describes any states that the asset might have, such as "Broken". Some states may disable the asset entirely.
States.title: States

Display.description: Data relevant to this item's display/rendering.
Display.title: Display

Aliases.description: Alternate names for this item, including: names it had earlier in development that have since changed, alternate spellings/punctuation, common misspellings, and so on.
Aliases.title: Aliases

Usage.description: Information on the asset's usage, such as whether its abilities are shared amongst the player characters.
Usage.title: Usage

Asset type.description: The ID of the asset's parent AssetType
Asset type.title: Asset type

Inputs.description: Data describing the Input controls that should be embedded in the card. Inputs embedded in specific asset abilities appear as keys of the corresponding ability object, instead.
Inputs.title: Inputs

Requirement.description: An optional markdown string representing the requirement text that appears at the top of some asset cards.
Requirement.title: Requirement

$id.description: The item's unique string ID. Any object that contains a localizable user-facing string *must* have this key.
$id.title: $id

Label.description: Ironsworn companion assets provide labels for their abilities. Starforged asset abilities do not have labels.
Label.title: Label

Moves.description: New moves added by this asset ability.
Moves.title: Moves

Inputs.description: User inputs (text, clocks, etc) associated with this asset ability.
Inputs.title: Inputs

Alter moves.description: Information on how this ability alters moves when enabled.
Alter moves.title: Alter moves

Alter properties.description: Information on how this ability alters its parent asset when enabled.
Alter properties.title: Alter properties

Alter momentum.description: Information on how this ability alters its owner's momentum (triggers an effect on burn, on reset, etc)
Alter momentum.title: Alter momentum

Enabled.description: Whether the asset ability is enabled or not. In most cases, the first asset ability defaults to 'true' and the others to 'false'. If none of an asset's abilities are set to 'true', the player can pick which the ability they start with when purchasing the asset.
Enabled.title: Enabled

Text.description: The item's rules text as a markdown string.
Text.title: Text

Burn.description: Information on how the player's momentum burn is altered.
Burn.title: Burn

Reset.description: Information on how the player's momentum reset is altered.
Reset.title: Reset

$id.description: The item's unique string ID. Any object that contains a localizable user-facing string *must* have this key.
$id.title: $id

Trigger.description: The trigger condition for altering the PC's momentum burn.
Trigger.title: Trigger

Effect.description: The effect altering the PC's momentum burn.
Effect.title: Effect

$id.description: The item's unique string ID. Any object that contains a localizable user-facing string *must* have this key.
$id.title: $id

HasText.description: Interface for items that reproduce Starforged rules text in markdown.
HasText.title: HasText

Text.description: The item's rules text as a markdown string.
Text.title: Text

$id.description: The item's unique string ID. Any object that contains a localizable user-facing string *must* have this key.
$id.title: $id

Trigger.description: The trigger condition for altering the PC's momentum reset.
Trigger.title: Trigger

Value.description: The amount by which the PC's momentum reset is change.
Value.title: Value

$id.description: The item's unique string ID. Any object that contains a localizable user-facing string *must* have this key.
$id.title: $id

Asset types.description: The type of asset that this asset accepts as attachments.
Asset types.title: Asset types

Max.description: The maximum number of attached assets accepted by this asset. If undefined or null, there is no maximum.
Max.title: Max

$id.description: The item's unique string ID. Any object that contains a localizable user-facing string *must* have this key.
$id.title: $id

Min.description: The minimum value of the meter. Usually this is 0. Momentum is currently the only exception to this and goes as low as -6.
Min.title: Min

Max.description: The maximum value of the meter.
Max.title: Max

Conditions.description: The conditions that can apply to this meter.

items.description: Conditions (such as impacts) that can apply to asset cards with condition meters. These are typically presented as tick boxes on the asset card.

Conditions.title: Conditions

Aliases.description: Certain common types of asset meters, like companion health and vehicle integrity, are collectively referenced by {@link MoveTriggerOptionAction.Using}. The array will include an appropriate alias if that is the case.

items.description:
Names of non-player condition meters (for e.g. companions and vehicles) that are referenced by moves and other assets.
If an asset condition meter can be used in this manner, the alias is included in its Aliases array.

Aliases.title: Aliases

Value.description: The initial value of the meter.
Value.title: Value

Rollable.description: Whether the meter value can be used in place of a stat in an action roll.
Rollable.title: Rollable

Label.description: The user-facing text label of this item.
Label.title: Label

Display_3.description: Interface for data relevant to an item's display/rendering.
Display_3.title: Display_3

Source_2.description: Interface representing data on this item's source. For 'canonical' content, this is usually a book with numbered pages, but it might also be a link to a web site.
Source_2.title: Source_2

ConditionMeter.description: Interface representing a condition meter such as health, spirit, supply.
ConditionMeter.title: ConditionMeter

$id.description: The item's unique string ID. Any object that contains a localizable user-facing string *must* have this key.
$id.title: $id

Min.description: The minimum value of the meter. Usually this is 0. Momentum is currently the only exception to this and goes as low as -6.
Min.title: Min

Max.description: The maximum value of the meter.
Max.title: Max

Conditions.description: The conditions that can apply to this meter.

items.description: Conditions (such as impacts) that can apply to asset cards with condition meters. These are typically presented as tick boxes on the asset card.

Conditions.title: Conditions

Aliases.description: Certain common types of asset meters, like companion health and vehicle integrity, are collectively referenced by {@link MoveTriggerOptionAction.Using}. The array will include an appropriate alias if that is the case.

items.description:
Names of non-player condition meters (for e.g. companions and vehicles) that are referenced by moves and other assets.
If an asset condition meter can be used in this manner, the alias is included in its Aliases array.

Aliases.title: Aliases

Value.description: The initial value of the meter.
Value.title: Value

Rollable.description: Whether the meter value can be used in place of a stat in an action roll.
Rollable.title: Rollable

Label.description: The user-facing text label of this item.
Label.title: Label

MoveCategory.description: Represents a category of moves such as "Session Moves" or "Combat Moves", and serves as a container for moves within that category.
MoveCategory.title: MoveCategory

$id.description: The item's unique string ID. Any object that contains a localizable user-facing string *must* have this key.
$id.title: $id

Description.description: A user-facing markdown description of the item, consisting of one or more paragraphs.
Description.title: Description

Display.description: Data relevant to this item's display/rendering.
Display.title: Display

Optional.description: Whether or not the source material presents this rules item as optional.
Optional.title: Optional

OracleSet.description: Represents an oracle set: a grouping that can contain both {@link OracleTable}s and other instances of {@link OracleSet}, but doesn't have its own `Table` key.
OracleSet.title: OracleSet

$id.description: The item's unique string ID. Any object that contains a localizable user-facing string *must* have this key.
$id.title: $id

Sample names.description: A list of sample names for this category. Only used by Planetary Class {@link OracleSet}s.
Sample names.title: Sample names

Sets.description:
Oracle sets contained by this set.

This key appears only on {@link OracleSet}, and thus only on 'branch' nodes of the oracle hierarchy 'tree'.
Sets.title: Sets

Tables.description:
Oracle tables contained by this set.

This key appears only on {@link OracleSet}, and thus only on 'branch' nodes of the oracle hierarchy 'tree'.
Tables.title: Tables

Display.description: Data relevant to this item's display/rendering.
Display.title: Display

Usage.description: Information on the usage of this oracle: recommended number of rolls, etc.
Usage.title: Usage

Summary.description: A user-facing markdown summary of the item. Summary is shorter than {@link HasDescription| Description}, when they're both present.
Summary.title: Summary

Description.description: A user-facing markdown description of the item, consisting of one or more paragraphs.
Description.title: Description

Content.description: Metadata that describes an oracle's semantic or lexical content.
Content.title: Content

Ancestors.description: An array containing the ID of every {@link OracleSet} ancestor of this item. The array is sorted from the most recent ancestor (e.g. one level up) to the most distant.
Ancestors.title: Ancestors

On a match.description:
Describes the match behaviour of this oracle's table, if any, and provides a `Text` string describing it. Only appears on a handful of move oracles like Ask the Oracle and Advance a Threat.

This key appears only on {@link OracleTable}s that have a `Table`.
On a match.title: On a match

OracleTable.description: Represents an oracle that has a `Table` composed of {@link OracleTableRow} objects. Appears only as a 'leaf' note on the oracle hierarchy 'tree'.
OracleTable.title: OracleTable

$id.description: The item's unique string ID. Any object that contains a localizable user-facing string *must* have this key.
$id.title: $id

Display.description: Data relevant to this item's display/rendering.
Display.title: Display

Table.description:
Represents a single oracle table, where 'table' is defined as being something with a single roll range.

This key appears only on {@link OracleSet}, and thus only on 'leaf' nodes of the oracle hierarchy 'tree'.
Table.title: Table

On a match.description: Describes the match behaviour of this oracle's table, if any, and provides a `Text` string describing it. Only appears on a handful of move oracles like Ask the Oracle and Advance a Threat.
On a match.title: On a match

Usage.description: Information on the usage of this oracle: recommended number of rolls, etc.
Usage.title: Usage

Summary.description: A user-facing markdown summary of the item. Summary is shorter than {@link HasDescription| Description}, when they're both present.
Summary.title: Summary

Description.description: A user-facing markdown description of the item, consisting of one or more paragraphs.
Description.title: Description

Content.description: Metadata that describes an oracle's semantic or lexical content.
Content.title: Content

Ancestors.description: An array containing the ID of every {@link OracleSet} ancestor of this item. The array is sorted from the most recent ancestor (e.g. one level up) to the most distant.
Ancestors.title: Ancestors

OracleTableDisplay.description: Information on displaying {@link OracleTable}, including information on its rendering in the original text.
OracleTableDisplay.title: OracleTableDisplay

Columns.description:
Information on the rendering of this table when it's provided as a standalone table (as opposed to a column of another table).

If close correspondence to the text's table rendering is desired, `Display["Column of"]` should be preferred (when present).
Columns.title: Columns

Column of.description:
If this oracle's `Table` should be rendered as a column of another table, it's indicated here.

If `undefined`, this table is rendered as a standalone table.

If this is set (and the rendering such 'embedded' columns is desired), then `Display.Table` may be safely ignored.
Column of.title: Column of

Embed in.description: This table is displayed as embedded in a row of another table.
Embed in.title: Embed in

Icon.description: A URL pointing to a single SVG icon.
Icon.title: Icon

Images.description: An array of URLs pointing to one or more WEBP images.
Images.title: Images

Color.description: A hex color associated with this item, for use as e.g. an accent color in its display.
Color.title: Color

$id.description: The item's unique string ID. Any object that contains a localizable user-facing string *must* have this key.
$id.title: $id

Label.description: The label or header text to use for this column.
Label.title: Label

$id.description: The item's unique string ID. Any object that contains a localizable user-facing string *must* have this key.
$id.title: $id

Content.description: The ID of the {@link OracleTable} whose {@link OracleTable.Table} content will be displayed in the table.
Content.title: Content

TableColumnText.description: Describes the rendering of a table column that displays textual content (as opposed to {@link TableColumnRoll}, which displays numerical ranges).
TableColumnText.title: TableColumnText

Label.description: The label or header text to use for this column.
Label.title: Label

Key.description: The key of each {@link OracleTableRow} in the {@link OracleTable.Table}, whose string value is displayed in the rendered table.
Key.title: Key

Content.description: The ID of the {@link OracleTable} whose {@link OracleTable.Table} content will be displayed in the table.
Content.title: Content

$id.description: The item's unique string ID. Any object that contains a localizable user-facing string *must* have this key.
$id.title: $id

RowNullStub.description: A row stub that has no dice range assigned to it, but still contains user-facing strings that are relevant to rendering the table. Typically, their dice range appears as "--" in the book.
RowNullStub.title: RowNullStub

Floor.description: The low end of the dice range for this row.
Floor.title: Floor

Ceiling.description: The high end of the dice range for this row.
Ceiling.title: Ceiling

Result.description:
The primary result text for the row, annotated in Markdown.
In the book, this is frequently the only column aside from the roll column. Otherwise, it is the first column.
Some tables label this column as something other than Result; see the parent (or grandparent) Oracle.Display for more information.
Result.title: Result

Summary.description:
A secondary markdown string that must be presented to the user for the implementation to be complete, but may benefit from progressive disclosure (such as a collapsible element, popover/tooltip, etc).

Generally, `Summary` is longer than `Result`.

Some tables label this column as something other than `Result`; see the parent (or grandparent) `Oracle.Display.Table` for more information.

`null` is used in cases where an 'empty' `Summary` exists (example: Starship Type, p. 326). In the book, these table cells are rendered with the text `--` (and this is the recommended placeholder for tabular display). For display as a single result (e.g. VTT table roll output), however, `null` values can be safely omitted.
Summary.title: Summary

Suggestions.description: "Non-canonical" suggestions of related items. They might be convenient to present to the user, but in most implementations rolling them automatically is not recommended.
Suggestions.title: Suggestions

Display.description: Data relevant to this item's display/rendering.
Display.title: Display

Content.description: Metadata that describes an oracle's semantic or lexical content.
Content.title: Content

Roll template.description: Describes the string values of this item that should be replaced with template strings and filled with the results of one or more oracle rolls.
Roll template.title: Roll template

Game objects.description: Any game objects that are explicitly pointed to by the original text. For most implementations, it is *not* recommended to generate them automatically - see "Peeling the Onion", p. 293.
Game objects.title: Game objects

Oracle rolls.description: Additional oracle tables that should be rolled when this row is selected.
Oracle rolls.title: Oracle rolls

Subtable.description: A table to be rolled when this row is selected. If this row references an external oracle, the `Oracles` property is used instead.
Subtable.title: Subtable

Multiple rolls.description: Data for rows that call for multiple rolls, e.g. on `Roll twice` results.
Multiple rolls.title: Multiple rolls

Attributes.description: The attributes set by this row.
Attributes.title: Attributes

$id.description: The item's unique string ID. Any object that contains a localizable user-facing string *must* have this key.
$id.title: $id

Text.description: The item's rules text as a markdown string.
Text.title: Text

OracleUsage.description: Describes the recommended usage of this item.
OracleUsage.title: OracleUsage

Initial.description:
Whether this table should be included in the initial oracle rolls when generating a game object. This is a somewhat arbitrary recommendation, and may not be appropriate for all implementations (or all game situations). Rather it's a reasonable starting point in *most* cases.

That said, the game itself recommends **against** rolling all possible results at once (see "Peeling the Onion", p. 293, *Starforged*). If your goal is to implement the game 'as-written', consider how you might include some means of "progressive disclosure" of oracle results.

May be deprecated in the future in favour of dedicated object template information.
Initial.title: Initial

Suggestions.description: "Non-canonical" suggestions of related items. They might be convenient to present to the user, but in most implementations rolling them automatically is not recommended.
Suggestions.title: Suggestions

Min rolls.description: The minimum number of rolls when using this oracle to create a game object, *if* this oracle is rolled. Assume it's 1 if not specified.
Min rolls.title: Min rolls

Max rolls.description: The maximum number of rolls when using this oracle to create a game object. Assume it's 1 if not specified.
Max rolls.title: Max rolls

Repeatable.description:
Whether the table's standard use is iterative.  Common examples are Feature, Opportunity, and Peril tables, which are most often used repeatedly to describe different areas of/events in a place, rather than being assigned as a description of the place as a whole.

Mutually exclusive with `Max rolls`. If undefined, assume `false`.
Repeatable.title: Repeatable

Allow duplicates.description: Whether multiple rolls (as in object generation, or with {@link MultipleRolls}) .
Allow duplicates.title: Allow duplicates

Sets.description: Hints which attributes are set by this table.
Sets.title: Sets

Roll template.description: Describes the string values of this item that should be replaced with template strings and filled with the results of one or more oracle rolls.
Roll template.title: Roll template

$id.description: The item's unique string ID. Any object that contains a localizable user-facing string *must* have this key.
$id.title: $id

RollTemplate_2.description: Describes the string keys of this item that should be replaced with template strings and filled with the results of one or more oracles.
RollTemplate_2.title: RollTemplate_2

OracleContent_2.description: Interface for metadata that describes an oracle's semantic or lexical content.
OracleContent_2.title: OracleContent_2

OracleSetDisplay.description:
Information on displaying {@link OracleSet}, including information on its rendering in the original text.

If an {@link OracleSet} has `Columns`, it represents a "supertable" composed of multiple roll or string columns.
OracleSetDisplay.title: OracleSetDisplay

$id.description: The item's unique string ID. Any object that contains a localizable user-facing string *must* have this key.
$id.title: $id

Columns.description:
Information on the rendering of this table when it's provided as a standalone table (as opposed to a column of another table).

If close correspondence to the text's table rendering is desired, `Display["Column of"]` should be preferred (when present).
Columns.title: Columns

Icon.description: A URL pointing to a single SVG icon.
Icon.title: Icon

Images.description: An array of URLs pointing to one or more WEBP images.
Images.title: Images

Color.description: A hex color associated with this item, for use as e.g. an accent color in its display.
Color.title: Color
